page.title: 13Area Worship
page.content: Holy Trinity, Long Sutton: First recorded, Holy Trinity Church was built in 852. It was rebuilt in blue lias and and hamstone in the l5th century. It has a good Somerset tower. The pulpit was carved in l455, the rood screen in l49O. The roof is tie-beam and wagon. The font is l5th century, and its cover Jacobean. The tower has 6 bells.The choir is R.S.C.M. Friends Meeting House: Quakers have met on this site for 3OO years. The Wesleys preached here regularly. Built in l7l7, the present Meeting House still contains most of the original woodwork. St. Mary's Long Load: This chuch was built in l854 of blue lias, with hamstone trimmings. There is a l7th Century pulpit.
